answers.answer: Hi,How are you?There can be many causes of lesions in the brain, like stroke, hypertension, diabetes, chronic alcoholism, migraines, alzhehimer’s disease, brain tumor, cerebral aneurysms, and MS.Where exactly these lesions located and what is the size?Your symptoms could be due to complex migraines and tension headache. The possibility of MS also cannot be ruled out completely.This requires further evaluation; please consult a neurologist with all your reports. Take care!

hi                                                                                                                                  thanks for your comment and i will seek further treatment . my lesions are located in the back lower part of my brain i dont remember what they called it  and they never told me the size but they did send me to a neurologist  but i couldnt afford to get the testings, but you know i do have symptoms of migraines and tension headache too but what about the tingling sensations down my back and spine what would cause that dont mean to be a pest just looking for information thanks for everything

Hi,Tingling sensations in the back and spine can be due to migraine. Other causes can be diabetes, B12 deficiency and nerve compression.Abnormal curvature of the spine can also cause tingling sensations in the spine.Hope this helps!
helped a lot thank you so much

question: hi i was in a car accident and hurt my neck and back but thats not my problem i said that to say this, i now suffer from headaches 24hrs a day and i had gotten a MRI done and they found lesion on my brain but could not afford further testing and i also have felt tingling or shocking sensations down my back and sometimes my arms and legs and i sometimes feel dizzy or light headed so what do  you think it could be MS or what else could it be please help i need some kind of idea
title: whats wrong with me
